action.action-desc: Mr. Sheehy introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to modify the percentage of highway safety program funds required to be spent by political subdivisions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Rural Safety Administration Flexibility Act.
Section 402(b) of title 23, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)(C), by inserting (or, in the case of a rural State, 20 percent) after 40 percent; and
by adding at the end the following:
In this subsection, the term rural State means any State, the population density of which is below the national average (as determined based on data from the most recent decennial Census).
